max.title: Aristophanous kōmōdiai duo Ploutos kai nephelai meta scholiōn palaiōn panu ōphelimōn = Aristophanis comœdæ duæ Plutus & Nubes : cum scholis græcis antiquis, quibus adjiciuntur notæ quædam, simul cum gemino indice

citation.creator: Aristophanes
citation.title: Five comedies
citation.summary: Classic Greek plays offer a caricature of Socrates, a flawed utopia, a clever plan to gain peace, and a debate between deceased playwrights.

citation.creator: Aristophanes
citation.title: Lysistrata
citation.summary: Film retelling of Lysistrata who convinced the women they could prevent war by withholding sexual favors from their husbands.

citation.creator: Aristophanes
citation.title: Aristophanes
citation.summary: A poet who hated an age of decadence, armed conflict, and departure from tradition, Aristophanes' comic genius influenced the political and social order of his own fifth-century Athens. But as Moses Hadas writes in his introduction to this volume, 'His true claim upon our attention is as the most brilliant and artistic and thoughtful wit our world has known.' Includes The Acharnians, The Birds, The Clouds, Ecclesiazusae, The Frogs, The Knights, Lysistrata, Peace, Plutus, Thesmophoriazusae, and The Wasps.

citation.creator: Oates, Whitney Jennings
citation.title: The complete Greek drama; all the extant tragedies of Aeschylus, Sophocles and Euripides, and the comedies of Aristophanes and Menander, in a variety of translations

citation.creator: Aristophanes
citation.title: The birds
citation.summary: Presents a reading of the ancient play about two Greek men who are disgusted with life in Athens and are seeking a new homeland among the birds.

citation.creator: Aristophanes
citation.title: The frogs
citation.summary: A Classical Greek play by Aristophanes performed in Greek by a Greek theatre company. The play is introduced by its Greek director. English subtitles. After Frogs, there is short segment of the play Electra by Sophocles, in colour, in Greek.

citation.creator: Aristophanes
citation.title: The wasps ; The poet and the women ; The frogs
citation.summary: This comedy is a satire of the system of jury courts in ancient Athens which provided an important means of support for a sizeable number of poor and elderly men through payment of three obols for a day's jury service.

citation.creator: Aristophanes
citation.title: Peace
citation.summary: Papyrus with Aristophanes' Peace 507-523 from Egypt. Verso has an unidentified literary text in Greek (P. Duk.inv. 643 V).

citation.title: Four texts on Socrates : Plato's Euthyphro, Apology, and Crito, and Aristophanes' Clouds

citation.creator: Aristophanes
citation.title: Aristophanous kōmōdiai duo Ploutos kai nephelai meta scholiōn palaiōn panu ōphelimōn = Aristophanis comœdæ duæ Plutus & Nubes : cum scholis græcis antiquis, quibus adjiciuntur notæ quædam, simul cum gemino indice

citation.creator: Littlefield, David J
citation.title: Twentieth century interpretations of The frogs; a collection of critical essays

citation.creator: Lord, Louis E
citation.title: Aristophanes; his plays and his influence

citation.creator: Carey, G. K
citation.title: Aristophanes' Lysistrata, The Birds, The Clouds, The Frogs notes

citation.creator: Russo, Carlo Ferdinando
citation.title: Aristophanes an author for the stage

citation.creator: Ehrenberg, Victor
citation.title: The people of Aristophanes; a sociology of old Attic comedy

citation.creator: MacDowell, Douglas M
citation.title: Aristophanes and Athens : an introduction to the plays

citation.creator: Van Steen, Gonda Aline Hector
citation.title: Venom in verse Aristophanes in modern Greece

citation.creator: O'Regan, Daphne Elizabeth
citation.title: Rhetoric, comedy, and the violence of language in Aristophanes' Clouds

citation.title: Spectator politics : metatheatre and performance in Aristophanes
